headline.main: Drugs Found to Keep Lost Flab Off

docs.lead_paragraph: A four-year study has concluded that prescription appetite suppressants can enable obese people to lose weight and keep it off. The patients in the federally financed study weighed an average of 200 pounds at the beginning, lost an average of more than 30 pounds and maintained the loss as long as they took the drugs, which for some people was three and a half years.
